p: Cancer is a major global disease burden with heavy morbidity and mortality affecting people around the world. Africa accounts for 7.3% of the cancer deaths and 5.8% of the total cancer incidence worldwide ( Bray et al., 2018). While cancer incidence among males has varied 6-fold from 79 per 100,000 ( Ferlay et al., 2015) to 95.6 per 100,000 ( Bray et al., 2018) in the West African region, it was recoded in Nigeria (2012–2013) at 94.2 per 100,000 and 160.2 per 100,000 among males and females, respectively ( Morounke et al., 2017).
